titles.title: A resolution designating June 2005 as "National Internet Safety Month".

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 5/18/2005--Passed Senate without amendment. Designates June 2005 as National Internet Safety Month. Recognizes that National Internet Safety Month provides an opportunity to educate the American people about the dangers and the importance of being safe and responsible online. Commends national and community organizations for their work in promoting such awareness and for providing information and training to develop the critical thinking and decision making skills needed to be safe online. Calls on Internet safety organizations, law enforcement, educators, community leaders, parents, and volunteers to increase their efforts to raise online safety awareness.
